Docs.summary: Positions and sizes the children of a StackLayout.
Docs.remarks: Implementors wishing to change the default behavior of a StackLayout should override this method. It is suggested to still call the base method and modify its calculated results.

Docs.param: The available width for the StackLayout to use.
The available height for the StackLayout to use.
Docs.summary: This method is called during the measure pass of a layout cycle to get the desired size of the StackLayout.
Docs.returns: A which contains the desired size of the StackLayout.
Docs.remarks: The results of this method will be a sum of all the desired sizes of its children along the orientation axis, and the maximum along the non-orientation axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Maui.Controls.StackOrientation Orientation { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype Microsoft.Maui.Controls.StackOrientation Orientation
member this.Orientation : Microsoft.Maui.Controls.StackOrientation with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates the direction which child elements are positioned.
Docs.value: A which indicates the direction children layouts flow. The default value is Vertical.
Docs.remarks: Setting the Orientation of a StackLayout triggers a layout cycle if the stack is already inside of a parent layout. To prevent wasted layout cycles, set the orientation prior to adding the StackLayout to a parent.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates the amount of space between each child element.
Docs.value: A value in device pixels which indicates the amount of space between each element. The default value is 6.0.

remarks.para: Setting this value triggers a layout cycle if the StackLayout is already in a parent Layout.
The following example sets the Spacing on construction of a StackLayout.
